On home form

We have been more patient and better defensively.
Then you build a belief and strength.
We believe we can turn it round no matter what happens.
The home support makes a difference.
It is too early to say it is a fortress like Highbury.

On Sanchez form vs newly-promoted sides

Maybe because we dominate these games and have more of the ball.
He has exceptional qualities that make a difference.
Most of it is down to his individual quality.

Changes ahead of United

The most important game is tomorrow.
We have a good chance to take three points at home and that is all that matters.
We have a big squad to deal with it.

On Wilshere

When he is fit, he is considered like everybody else.
He is at that level now.
Every opportunity he gets, he can commit his future.
Could he leave in January?

I don’t think long-term.

On Sanchez and Ozil futures

Will they be here on February 1st?

Yes. Of course.
I rule it out.
I don’t think every day about it.
As long as they are here, they have to give their all for the club.
In my head, they are here until the end of the season.
That was the decision at the start of the season.
Unless something incredible happens, I don’t think that will change.
We are not in December yet!
For me, they stay until the end of the season. Will they stay longer? That is impossible to answer today.
But they have a contract until the end of the season.

Will they be here next season?

I am not the only one who decides that.

ä¸‰å€‹ä¸€é½Šèµ°

On title chances

The only way to keep that alive is to win every game.
I don’t compare myself to other managers. I focus on doing my job.
I can live with any opinion.
What is most important is not what people think, it is what I can do for Arsenal.

On Huddersfield challenge

It is a massive game for me.
They didn’t deserve to lose against City.
They had to play 46 games in the Championship and have proven they are ready for a fight.
They are dangerous for every Premier League side.

On knitting

I hope you don’t have to wear a jumper from my knitting.
It won’t look very good!


On substituting Lacazette

First of all, I would like to say in my job, you sub strikers more than defenders.
They have to create, provoke and be incisive.
He has adapted physically to the Premier League and I am very happy with his work.
I have other options on the bench who are fresh and give us other variations in our attack.
Physically, the Premier League demands a huge intensity of work.
A lot of teams change their strikers around 60-80 minutes.
They work on their own up front against two or three people. It is much more exhausting physically and mentally.

Are Arsenal at their best?

Improvement is always possible.
We want to keep the good things we have done recently but we always want to prove.
Going forward, we want to be more prolific and take more chances.
Defensively, we are a lot stronger.

Have City sewn the title up already?

No, I don’t think so.
It is too early to say that.
Every team has its vulnerabilities, even Man City.
We are in November and you win the title in May.
It is not good [to have such a dominant team].
Every match is unpredictable.

Head of football relations joins from Barcelona



We are delighted to announce that Raul Sanllehi is joining us as head of football relations.

Raul has been at Barcelona for the past 14 years. He will join us in February to lead future player negotiations and work alongside manager Arsène Wenger, chief executive Ivan Gazidis and contract negotiator Huss Fahmy.

He will also represent and support the club with international and domestic governing bodies.

The appointment follows the recent announcement of Sven Mislintat to head our player recruitment operations and Gazidis said: “In the past three years we have supplemented our team with more top-class expertise across every aspect of our football operations.

"Raul’s appointment is another important step in developing the infrastructure we need at the club to take everything we do to the next level. Raul has extensive contacts across the football world and has been directly involved in some of the biggest transfers in Europe in recent years. We look forward to him bringing that expertise to Arsenal.”

https://www.arsenal.com/news/head-football-relations-joins-barcelona

Pardew


West Brom are set to appoint former Newcastle and Crystal Palace boss Alan Pardew as their manager on Wednesday.

The Baggies sacked Tony Pulis on 20 November after going 10 Premier League games without a victory and sitting a point above the relegation zone.

Pardew, who has been out of the game since being sacked by Palace in December 2016, is expected to sign a deal until 2020.
